meanings.definition: An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed an ancient relic from the Roman Empire.
meanings.sent2: She treasured the relic of her grandmother's necklace.
meanings.sent3: Finding a relic in the attic made for a surprising discovery.
meanings.sent4: The relic of the past whispered stories of bygone eras.
meanings.sent5: The relic gleamed with the secrets of history.

meanings.definition: A part of a deceased holy person's body or belongings kept as an object of reverence.
meanings.sent1: The church displayed a relic of Saint Peter's robe.
meanings.sent2: Pilgrims traveled far to see the relic of the saint's finger bone.
meanings.sent3: The relic was believed to bring blessings to those who touched it.
meanings.sent4: The relic was a sacred link to the divine.
meanings.sent5: The relic exuded an aura of sanctity.

meanings.definition: A surviving trace or vestige of something past.
meanings.sent1: The old ruins were the only relic of the ancient city.
meanings.sent2: His faded handwriting was a relic of his time as a student.
meanings.sent3: The relic of his childhood dream lingered in his heart.
meanings.sent4: The relic of the past echoed through the empty halls.
meanings.sent5: The relic of memory held the key to the forgotten.
